text.section: Before or after a complaint is filed under this subtitle, the State's Attorney may hold a pretrial inquiry.

section.section:
If a person fails to obey a summons, or fails to testify or comply with a request of the State's Attorney, the State's Attorney may request the circuit court for the county to order the person:
to obey the summons;
to testify; or
to produce any document that the court considers necessary for the inquiry.
If a person fails or refuses to obey the order of court after the order has been served, the person is in contempt of court and the court may punish the person for the contempt.
A finding of contempt under this subsection is subject to appeal.
